timeline.message:
Removes plantantion flowers from florist

Signed-off-by: Mark E. Schill <Mark.Schill@cmschill.net>

timeline.bodyText: that should probably be filtered in the copyOfPlantables creation
timeline.author: Raycoms
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -221,7 +222,9 @@ public ItemStack getFlowerToGrow()
             case 4:
             case 5:
             default:
-                return IColonyManager.getInstance().getCompatibilityManager().getCopyOfPlantables();

replies.bodyText: I thought that was used in the compost section but you are correct
replies.author: PowerSchill

timeline.message:
Moves filter to CompatibilityManager

Signed-off-by: Mark E. Schill <Mark.Schill@cmschill.net>

timeline.bodyText: I mean, we should prevent them getting into this list in the first place.
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: No need to filter every call the list.
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: Ok, I see now. discoverablePlantables refers to compostable items but its beecause it w was copied from compostable not that it used them. I will fix.
replies.author: PowerSchill

timeline.message:
Moves filter to appropriate scope

Signed-off-by: Mark E. Schill <Mark.Schill@cmschill.net>

timeline.bodyText: Can't we actually put this in the isPlantable check? Would be much more efficient.
timeline.author: Raycoms

timeline.message:
Relocates filtering for plantables

Signed-off-by: Mark E. Schill <Mark.Schill@cmschill.net>

timeline.bodyText: Lol, I just checked into the config file and actually the reason it's here in the first place is because it's in the list of plantables in the default config. So just removing it there should solve this for the future already.
timeline.author: Raycoms

timeline.message:
Switches to configuration based control

Signed-off-by: Mark E. Schill <Mark.Schill@cmschill.net>
